title: 110_hr1944
content: The Act titled "Veterans Traumatic Brain Injury Treatment Act of 2007" amends Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, by adding a new subchapter for screening, rehabilitation, and treatment for traumatic brain injury. The Act establishes a screening program for veterans eligible for medical care to screen for traumatic brain injury symptoms. The Secretary must submit an annual report on the number of veterans screened, prevalence of symptoms, and recommendations for care. Additionally, a comprehensive program for long-term traumatic brain injury rehabilitation will be developed and implemented. The Secretary will develop a comprehensive program for long-term care of post-acute traumatic brain injury rehabilitation at four designated polytrauma network sites. Eligibility includes veterans who served in combat operations after the Persian Gulf War, have moderate to severe traumatic brain injury, and are unable to manage daily activities. The Secretary will establish traumatic brain injury transition offices at Department polytrauma network sites to coordinate healthcare and services for veterans with moderate to severe traumatic brain injuries. A report on the program's operation, number of veterans served, and annual costs will be submitted annually to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs. The Secretary will establish traumatic brain injury transition offices at Department polytrauma network sites to coordinate healthcare and services for veterans with moderate to severe traumatic brain injuries. These offices will provide health-care and services through cooperative agreements with public or private entities that have established long-term neurobehavioral rehabilitation and recovery programs. Additionally, the Secretary shall establish and maintain a registry known as the `Traumatic Brain Injury Veterans' Health Registry' to include information on veterans exhibiting symptoms associated with traumatic brain injury. The Secretary will establish a Traumatic Brain Injury Veterans' Health Registry to include relevant medical data and information on veterans with traumatic brain injuries. The Registry will notify individuals of significant developments in research on the health consequences of military service in specific theaters of operations. The Secretary will establish a Traumatic Brain Injury Veterans' Health Registry to include relevant medical data and information on veterans with traumatic brain injuries, notifying individuals of significant developments in research on the health consequences of military service in specific Operation Iraqi Freedom theaters of operations. Subchapter IX of title 38, United States Code, includes screening, rehabilitation, transition offices, and a registry for traumatic brain injuries. The Secretary must implement these requirements within 180 days of the enactment of the Act.
